description.value: A volume of chants to the Morninglord.

The Blade of Truth: The Uses of Logic in the War Against Diabolist Heresies, as Fought by the Ulmist Inquisition

A strange book that mixes logic exercises with lurid descriptions of fiend-worshiping cults.
This is a well crafted book, just waiting for an author to complete it.
An opaque orange to red-brown gemstone worth 50 gold pieces
A transparent rich olive green gemstone worth 500 gold pieces
A transparent blue-white, canary, pink, brown, or blue gemstone worth 100 gold pieces.
A bullseye lantern casts bright light in a 60-foot cone and dim light for an additional 60 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil.

Hail thee of might and valor:

I, the Burgomaster of Barovia, send you honor—with despair.

My adopted daughter, the fair Ireena Kolyana, has been these past nights bitten by a vampyr. For over four hundred years, this creature has drained the life blood of my people. Now, my dear Ireena languishes and dies from an unholy wound caused by this vile beast. He has become too powerful to conquer.

So I say to you, give us up for dead and encircle this land with the symbols of good. Let holy men call upon their power that the devil may be contained within the walls of weeping Barovia. Leave our sorrows to our graves, and save the world from this evil fate of ours.

There is much wealth entrapped in this community. Return for your reward after we are all departed for a better life.

Kolyan Indirovich
Burgomaster

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

description.value:
Made from the branch of a Gulthias tree (see the blights entry in the Monster Manual), a Gulthias staff is a spongy, black length of wood. Its evil makes beasts visibly uncomfortable while within 30 feet of it. The staff has 10 charges and regains 1d6 + 4 of its expended charges daily at dusk.

If the staff is broken or burned to ashes, its wood releases a terrible, inhuman scream that can be heard out to a range of 300 feet. All blights that can hear the scream immediately wither and die.

Vampiric Strike. The staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff. On a hit, it deals damage as a normal quarterstaff, and you can expend 1 charge to regain a number of hit points equal to the damage dealt by the weapon. Each time a charge is spent, red blood oozes from the staff’s pores, and you must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or be afflicted with short-term madness (see “Madness” in chapter 8 of the Dungeon Master’s Guide).

Blight Bane. While you are attuned to the staff, blights and other evil plant creatures don’t regard you as hostile unless you harm them.
A staff made from the black branch of a tree. This looks... Unwholesome.

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

description.value: The wand has 3 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 of its charges, and if a secret door or trap is within 30 feet of you, the wand pulses and points at the one nearest to you. The wand regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.
This staff feels cool to the touch.

(Requires attunement by a druid, sorcerer, warlock, or wizard)

You have resistance to cold damage while you hold this staff.

The staff has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.RpKjTlYASrfqUPVA]{Cone of Cold} (5 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.IBJmWjzbQGu7M4UX]{Fog Cloud} (1 charge), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.WN2LWEljYU6QqnRH]{Ice Storm} (4 charges), or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.fzZnVKLmBMo2f5up]{Wall of Ice} (4 charges).

The staff regains 1d6 + 4 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the staff turns to water and is destroyed.
A green copper ewer embossed with images of dancing bears, elks, and wolves.
